longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid for a minimum of 3 months from the arrival date. 

Visa required, except for Holders of a valid visa issued by
Oman to nationals of Switzerland.(SEE NOTE 11005) 
    NOTE 11005: Holders of such visa can enter either Oman or
   Qatar but are not allowed to depart to a third country.  
Visa Issuance:
Visa required, except for Nationals of Switzerland can obtain
a visa on arrival for a max. stay of 1 month. Fee: between QAR
50.- and QAR 150.-.
- Infants under 2 years of age, born to alien residents of
  Qatar can obtain a visa on arrival.
  
Minors:
- Own passport is not required for children if
  
- WARNING! In accordance with European Union (EU) Legislation,
  all minors who are nationals of Switzerland will be expected
  to hold their own passport or National ID Card (where
  applicable) when departing from Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus,
  Romania or a Schengen Member State . 
Additional Information:
- Visitors are required to hold proof of sufficient funds to
  cover their stay and documents required for their next
  destination. 
- All passengers staying in Qatar for more than 1 month must
  obtain a Residence Permit after arrival. 
Warning:
- Visitors not holding return/onward ticket could be refused
  entry. 
- E-visas issued by Qatar must be validated prior to boarding
  at www.moi.gov.qa/site/eServices/services/indexE.html by
  clicking on the  Visa Enquiry and Printing  button. 
- Visitors holding a tourist visa must also have proof of
  confirmed hotel reservation and at least USD 1,400.- or a
  major credit card
